column2: Listen to the interview. Are the statements true or not?
column3:
He's never been able to run fast. {{c1::Not true}}
He used to be able to run long distances. {{c1::Not true}}
He'd like to be able to run a marathon. {{c1::True}}
column6:
A: How do you keep fit?
B: Running.  I go running every day.
A: How far do you run?
B: Not far.  About four kilometres.  I could never run long distances.  I never had the stamina.  I could run quite fast when I was younger but never very far.  Now I can't run far and I can't run fast either.
A: So you've never run a marathon then.
B: No, I couldn't do it, which is a shame. It must be great to run a marathon.

column6:
A: Can you draw? 
B: No, I'm not good at drawing.  I've never learnt to draw.  I've never been able to do it.
A: Can you sing?
B: Not well.  I used to be able to, but I can't any more.  Maybe if I practised, I could learn again.
A: Can you speak a foreign language?
B: No.  I know a little Spanish, but that's all.  I went to some classes, but I didn't get very far.  It's a pity.  I'd like to be able to speak a foreign language.
